tasks.explanation: The assignment is broken down into logical stages: initial understanding, core database design, practical SQL implementation, performance considerations, and final documentation. This mirrors a typical workflow for a database project, ensuring each component is addressed systematically.

parts.detail: Read and understand all assignment requirements and context.
parts.label: Setup & Research
parts.notes: Read and understand all assignment requirements and context.
parts.title: Part 1 - Setup & Research
parts.why_in_plan: This is the foundation phase and must be completed before implementation.

parts.detail: Design the relational schema, identify primary and foreign keys, and explain redundancy avoidance.
parts.label: Part A: Schema Design
parts.notes: Design the relational schema, identify primary and foreign keys, and explain redundancy avoidance.
parts.title: Part 2 - Part A: Schema Design
parts.why_in_plan: This is the main implementation work that applies your planning and research.

parts.detail: Write the three required SQL queries (SELECT, COUNT, UPDATE). Consider testing them in a local PostgreSQL environment.
parts.label: Part B: SQL Queries
parts.notes: Write the three required SQL queries (SELECT, COUNT, UPDATE). Consider testing them in a local PostgreSQL environment.
parts.title: Part 3 - Part B: SQL Queries
parts.why_in_plan: This applies the concepts from earlier parts.

parts.detail: Suggest an appropriate index for a query and explain its benefits and limitations.
parts.label: Part C: Indexing & Performance
parts.notes: Suggest an appropriate index for a query and explain its benefits and limitations.
parts.title: Part 4 - Part C: Indexing & Performance
parts.why_in_plan: This reinforces learning and ensures comprehensive understanding.

parts.detail: Assemble all parts into a single PDF document, including schema diagram, SQL queries, and short answers. Review for clarity, correctness, and completeness.
parts.label: Documentation & Review
parts.notes: Assemble all parts into a single PDF document, including schema diagram, SQL queries, and short answers. Review for clarity, correctness, and completeness.
parts.title: Part 5 - Documentation & Review
parts.why_in_plan: Testing ensures your implementation works correctly and meets requirements.

tasks.explanation: The assignment is broken down into initial project setup and data preparation, followed by core feature development (authentication, dashboard metrics, visualizations). The final stages focus on quality assurance (responsiveness, UI/UX, performance) and completing deliverables like documentation.

parts.detail: Choose front-end framework (React/Vue) and CSS framework (Tailwind/Bootstrap). Set up project environment. Prepare mock data (JSON/API) for charts and tables.
parts.label: Project Setup & Data Mocking
parts.notes: Choose front-end framework (React/Vue) and CSS framework (Tailwind/Bootstrap). Set up project environment. Prepare mock data (JSON/API) for charts and tables.
parts.title: Part 1 - Project Setup & Data Mocking
parts.why_in_plan: This is the foundation phase and must be completed before implementation.

parts.detail: Implement login/logout functionality with session handling.
parts.label: User Authentication
parts.notes: Implement login/logout functionality with session handling.
parts.title: Part 2 - User Authentication
parts.why_in_plan: This creates the user-facing components of your application.

parts.detail: Build the homepage dashboard structure. Display key metrics: total sales, new users, and daily traffic.
parts.label: Dashboard Core & Metrics Display
parts.notes: Build the homepage dashboard structure. Display key metrics: total sales, new users, and daily traffic.
parts.title: Part 3 - Dashboard Core & Metrics Display
parts.why_in_plan: This applies the concepts from earlier parts.

parts.detail: Add 3-4 visual charts for sales trends, top products, and user engagement.
parts.label: Data Visualization Implementation
parts.notes: Add 3-4 visual charts for sales trends, top products, and user engagement.
parts.title: Part 4 - Data Visualization Implementation
parts.why_in_plan: This is the main implementation work that applies your planning and research.

parts.detail: Ensure full responsiveness for desktop and mobile. Apply consistent UI design principles and accessibility. Optimize rendering performance.
parts.label: Responsiveness, UI/UX & Performance
parts.notes: Ensure full responsiveness for desktop and mobile. Apply consistent UI design principles and accessibility. Optimize rendering performance.
parts.title: Part 5 - Responsiveness, UI/UX & Performance
parts.why_in_plan: This creates the user-facing components of your application.

parts.detail: Document code, ensure readability and proper structure. Create a concise README file. Final testing and polish.
parts.label: Code Refinement & Deliverables
parts.notes: Document code, ensure readability and proper structure. Create a concise README file. Final testing and polish.
parts.title: Part 6 - Code Refinement & Deliverables
parts.why_in_plan: This is foundational and needs to be completed first.

tasks.explanation: This 4-hour plan focuses on establishing the foundational elements of the project: setting up the development environment, implementing the core authentication user interface, and building the basic structural shell of the dashboard. This prepares the groundwork for integrating data, charts, and full responsiveness in subsequent work blocks.

parts.detail: Choose front-end framework (React/Vue) and CSS framework (Tailwind/Bootstrap). Set up project boilerplate and plan basic component structure. Prepare initial mock data structure.
parts.label: Setup & Initial Research
parts.notes: Choose front-end framework (React/Vue) and CSS framework (Tailwind/Bootstrap). Set up project boilerplate and plan basic component structure. Prepare initial mock data structure.
parts.title: Part 1 - Setup & Initial Research
parts.why_in_plan: This is the foundation phase and must be completed before implementation.

parts.detail: Implement login and logout UI components. Set up basic client-side state management for authentication (e.g., a simple 'isLoggedIn' state) without complex session handling.
parts.label: Basic Authentication UI
parts.notes: Implement login and logout UI components. Set up basic client-side state management for authentication (e.g., a simple 'isLoggedIn' state) without complex session handling.
parts.title: Part 2 - Basic Authentication UI
parts.why_in_plan: This creates the user-facing components of your application.

parts.detail: Create the main dashboard layout component. Display placeholders or very basic UI for key metrics (total sales, new users, daily traffic) using the chosen CSS framework.
parts.label: Dashboard Layout Shell & Metrics Placeholders
parts.notes: Create the main dashboard layout component. Display placeholders or very basic UI for key metrics (total sales, new users, daily traffic) using the chosen CSS framework.
parts.title: Part 3 - Dashboard Layout Shell & Metrics Placeholders
parts.why_in_plan: This applies the concepts from earlier parts.

blocks.title: Part 3 - Dashboard Layout Shell & Metrics Placeholders
